intro: Mollinedia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Mollinedia pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
